skill.name: Skill Creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains legitimate utility scripts for creating and packaging Codex skills. Scripts access filesystem at user-specified paths to create skill directories and validate SKILL.md structure. No network calls, external command execution, or environment variable access detected. Behavior matches stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Creating new skills from scratch is time-consuming without proper guidance. This skill provides a step-by-step process for building reusable skills with templates, bundled resources, and packaging tools.
actual_capabilities: Provides init_skill.py for generating skill templates
Explains progressive disclosure design for context efficiency
limitations: Does not execute external code or access network resources
Scripts run locally and do not integrate with cloud services
Does not provide pre-built skills for specific domains

use_cases.title: Build custom Codex skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills that extend Codex with domain-specific knowledge and workflows for your projects.

use_cases.title: Standardize team workflows
use_cases.description: Develop shared skills that encode best practices, coding standards, and organizational guidelines for your team.

use_cases.title: Package reusable expertise
use_cases.description: Bundle expertise into distributable skills that others can install and use for consistent results.

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use-case description]. Walk me through the 6-step skill creation process.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my skill at [path/to/skill] using the quick_validate.py script. What issues need fixing?

prompt_templates.title: Package skill for distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: Package my skill at [path/to/skill] into a .skill file for distribution. Use the package_skill.py script.

prompt_templates.title: Design progressive disclosure
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me structure my skill using progressive disclosure principles. I want to keep SKILL.md under 500 lines by moving details to reference files.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for processing PDF files
output: ‚úì SKILL.md template generated with YAML frontmatter
‚úì Example directories added: scripts/, references/, assets/
‚úì Next steps: Edit SKILL.md to describe PDF processing capabilities

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise and under 500 lines using progressive disclosure
Include scripts only when deterministic reliability is required
Use references for detailed documentation that Codex loads as needed
Name skills with lowercase hyphen-case and descriptive verbs
anti_patterns: Adding redundant documentation like README.md or INSTALL.md
Including everything in SKILL.md without using reference files
Creating deeply nested reference structures beyond one level
Using spaces or special characters in skill names

faq.question: Which AI tools support skills?
faq.answer: Skills work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool loads skills based on skill metadata and descriptions.

faq.question: What is the maximum skill name length?
faq.answer: Skill names must be 64 characters or less after normalization to lowercase hyphen-case.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Reference files can link to external documentation. Scripts can call APIs but do not make network calls themselves.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Scripts run locally on your machine. They create files at paths you specify and read only skill-related files.

faq.question: Why does my validation fail?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing frontmatter, invalid YAML, name not in hyphen-case, or description with angle brackets.

faq.question: How does this differ from prompt templates?
faq.answer: Skills are comprehensive packages with bundled scripts, references, and assets. They provide reusable infrastructure beyond prompt patterns.
